meanings.definition: Of or relating to the gladiolus plant.
meanings.sent1: The gladiolar flowers in the garden were vibrant and colorful.
meanings.sent2: The gladiolar leaves were long and slender, reaching towards the sun.
meanings.sent3: The gladiolar plant seemed to wave happily in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a gladiolar bloom in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The gladiolar petals danced gracefully in the wind, like delicate ballerinas.

meanings.definition: Resembling a gladiolus in shape or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The sword had a gladiolar shape, tapering to a sharp point.
meanings.sent2: Her dress had a gladiolar design, with flowing lines and vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The gladiolar cake looked almost too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: His voice was as strong and commanding as a gladiolar stem.
meanings.sent5: The gladiolar clouds in the sky resembled giant feathers floating above.
